channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Palace move for £50m Strand Larsen in doubt
item.description: Crystal Palace's £50m move for Wolves striker Jorgen Strand Larsen is in the balance after the Eagles suggest they could walk away from the deal.

item.title: How English clubs got smart to dominate this season's Champions League
item.description: Premier League clubs always had the money, but now they also have the know-how they have dominated this season's Champions League.

item.title: Why Holland could be key to Man Utd's revival under Carrick
item.description: Why former England and Chelsea coach Steve Holland could be the key appointment in new boss Michael Carrick's coaching team at Manchester United.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v boxer Francesca Hennessy
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on boxer Francesca Hennessy and AI with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Arsenal in talks to sign Barcelona's Batlle in summer
item.description: Arsenal have held advanced discussions with Barcelona full-back Ona Batlle in the hope of reaching a pre-contract agreement to sign her in the summer.

item.title: Senegal boss Thiaw banned after Afcon final chaos
item.description: Senegal manager Pape Thiaw his banned for five games after the chaotic scenes during the Africa Cup of Nations final against Morocco.

item.title: Thirteen clubs punished for match-fixing in China
item.description: Nine teams will start the upcoming Chinese Super League season on minus points after clubs were sanctioned following an investigation.

item.title: Sterling in talks with seven clubs - Friday's gossip
item.description: Raheem Sterling's representatives in talks with seven clubs, Tottenham and Burnley also interested in England winger, Cole Palmer out of Manchester United's price range, plus more.

item.title: Bompastor tracks back on WSL title 'gone' comments
item.description: Chelsea manager Sonia Bompastor has tracked back on her comments saying the WSL title is "probably over" by insisting her side will "never give up".

item.title: How 'star signing' Ekitike is leading the way for Liverpool
item.description: Champions League pundits Stephen Warnock and Julien Laurens discuss how Hugo Ekitike has become the "star signing" of Arne Slot's Liverpool side.

item.title: 'It's absolutely brilliant!' - Trubin's goal sends Benfica into play-offs
item.description: Champions League pundits Stephen Warnock, Nedum Onuoha and Julien Laurens analyse Benfica goalkeeper Anatoliy Trubin's 98th-minute goal which sent his side into the play-offs.

item.title: Havertz return a 'big boost' for Arsenal
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Nedum Onuoha analyses how Kai Havertz's return gives a "big boost" to Mikel Arteta's Arsenal side.

item.title: Eat & Yap - Man City's Kerstin Casparij meets Alex Scott
item.description: Manchester City's exciting full-back Kerstin Casparij answers Alex Scott's quickfire questions in BBC Sport's new Eat & Yap series.

item.title: 'Barca move gave me confidence I could adapt'
item.description: Chelsea's Lucy Bronze - England's most decorated female footballer - tells BBC Sport's Emma Sanders that she "found even more confidence in myself" after leaving Manchester City in 2022.

item.title: How 'clinical' Tottenham beat Frankfurt
item.description: Champions League pundits Stephen Warnock, Nedum Onuoha and Julien Lauren discuss Tottenham's "clinical ability" to score goals away from home and Thomas Frank's "great achievement" to handle the pressure.

item.title: Trubin's 'miracle' - how Mourinho's Benfica stunned Real Madrid
item.description: Goalkeeper Anatoly Trubin's header gives Jose Mourinho an unforgettable moment as Benfica beat Real Madrid to stay alive in the Champions League.

item.title: Do Villa have the legs to end their 30-year trophy drought?
item.description: An injury crisis and a returning hero. Aston Villa's season continues to take sharp turns.

item.title: Captain 'essential' Fernandes - FPL team of the week
item.description: With a juicy run of fixtures coming up and his team in top attacking form, Bruno Fernandes is an easy captain choice this week, writes Thomas Woods.

item.title: Aberdeen sign 'physical and robust' Aremu
item.description: Aberdeen sign Nigeria defensive midfielder Afeez Aremu from German side Kaiserslautern.

item.title: Why have English teams dominated as Real & PSG face play-offs?
item.description: Five of the eight teams to qualify automatically for the Champions League were from the Premier League, so why have they been so dominant?

item.title: 'When something needs doing, people say to just ask Lucy'
item.description: England and Chelsea defender Lucy Bronze speaks to BBC Sport about finding more confidence with age and why chasing titles is more exciting.

item.title: Man City's Casparij on Manchester, cats and being mistaken for a gardener
item.description: In BBC Sport's Eat & Yap series, Alex Scott meets some of the best WSL players to share the food they love and to chat about life on and off the pitch.

item.title: How 'vitally important' substitutions gave Rosenoir 'huge win' over Napoli
item.description: BBC Sport pundits Nedum Onuoha and Stephen Warnock analyse why the link-up between Joao Pedro and second-half substitute Cole Palmer was the catalyst for Chelsea's 3-2 win over Napoli.

item.title: How Doku's 'clever decision-making' helped City beat Galatasaray
item.description: Champions League pundits Stephen Warnock, Nedum Onuoha and Julien Laurens discuss Manchester City's 2-0 win over Galatasaray game and how Jeremy Doku has "found his form again" with "clever decision-making".

item.title: Howe's subs inspired 'absolutely superb' second half against PSG
item.description: BBC Sport pundit Stephen Warnock analyses how substitutes Harvey Barnes and Anthony Gordon helped "stretch the game" in the second half of Newcastle United's 1-1 draw against PSG.

item.title: Liverpool march into last 16 with six-goal Qarabag thrashing
item.description: Liverpool thrash Qarabag 6-0 to automatically reach the last 16 of the Champions League.

item.title: Pedro scores superb double to give Chelsea top eight finish
item.description: Joao Pedro scores twice as Chelsea beat Napoli 3-2 to secure automatic qualification into the last 16 of the UEFA Champions League.

item.title: Arsenal maintain perfect record with narrow win over Kairat
item.description: First-half goals from Viktor Gyokeres, Kai Havertz and Gabriel Martinelli give Arsenal a 3-2 win over Kairat to completing a perfect league phase for the Gunners with eight victories in eight games.

item.title: Spurs see off Frankfurt to secure last 16 qualification
item.description: Goals from Randal Kolo Muani and Dominic Solanke give Tottenham a comfortable 2-0 away win against Eintracht Frankfurt, as Thomas Frank's side finish the league phase in fourth to automatically qualify for the last 16 of the Champions League.

item.title: Newcastle face play-off after draw with holders PSG
item.description: Joe Willock scores for Newcastle as they draw 1-1 with PSG at the Parc des Princes to confirm their place in the Champions League play-offs.

item.title: Man City avoid play-offs with Galatasary win
item.description: Manchester City beat Galatasaray to confirm a spot in the round of 16 of the UEFA Champions League by narrowly finishing eighth in the league phase.

item.title: Watch Benfica keeper score stoppage-time goal against Real Madrid
item.description: Goalkeeper Anatoliy Trubin scores in the 98th minute to give Benfica a 4-2 win over Real Madrid - a goal which also secured Jose Mourinho's side a place in the last 16 play-offs of the Champions League on goal difference.

item.title: Bayern secure league phase spot with victory over PSV
item.description: Jamal Musiala scores on his first start for Bayern Munich since July as they secure second spot in the league phase of the Champions League with a hard-fought win at PSV Eindhoven.

item.title: Hibs striker Bowie set for Verona medical
item.description: Hibernian striker Kieron Bowie is due to fly to Italy on Friday for a medical as he moves closer to a switch to Hellas Verona.

item.title: Brighton to reject £20m Forest bid for Ayari
item.description: Brighton are set to reject a £20m offer from Nottingham Forest for midfielder Yasin Ayari.

item.title: 'Big blow' for Bradley to miss play-off - O'Neill
item.description: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill says it "would certainly be nice" for the injured Conor Bradley to still be a part of the squad for their 2026 World Cup play-offs against Italy in March.

item.title: Nicholl death certificate changed to reflect head trauma
item.description: The death certificate of Chris Nicholl is changed to reflect he had brain disease linked to repetitive head trauma.

item.title: Six of the most memorable goalkeeper goals
item.description: After Anatoliy Trubin's dramatic winner for Benfica against Real Madrid, BBC Sport looks at the most memorable goals by goalkeepers.

item.title: Rosenior comes out on top as Conte's European woes continue
item.description: Antonio Conte lifted the Champions League as a player in 1995-96 but has experienced nothing but despair as a manager in the competition.

item.title: Newcastle prove they can mix it with European champions
item.description: Newcastle United have experienced all manner of emotions at the Parc des Princes, but the visitors left with immense pride following a 1-1 draw against Paris St-Germain

item.title: Rashford scores as Barcelona beat Copenhagen
item.description: Marcus Rashford gets on the scoresheet as Barcelona come from behind to soundly defeat Copenhagen 4-1, as they secure automatic qualification into the last 16 of the Champions League.

item.title: Keeper scores dramatic late goal against Real to put Benfica into play-offs
item.description: Benfica goalkeeper Anatoliy Trubin scores in stoppage time to help his side into the play-offs on goal difference after a thrilling win 4-2 win over nine-man Real Madrid.

item.title: Club Brugge thrash Marseille to progress to play-offs
item.description: Club Brugge qualify for the play-off round of the Champions League after a 3-0 win over Marseille, to knock the French side out of the competition.

item.title: Sporting leave it late to beat Athletic Club
item.description: Alisson Santos' 94th minute goal gives Sporting CP a 3-2 win over Athletic Club as the Portuguese champions automatically qualify for the last 16 of the UEFA Champions League.

item.title: Inter beat Dortmund but miss out on Champions League top eight
item.description: Federico Dimarco scored his first Champions League goal of the season against Borussia Dortmund as Inter Milan win 0-2 at the Signal Iduna Park.

item.title: Tillman scores twice to secure play-offs for Leverkusen
item.description: Malik Tillman scores twice as Bayer Leverkusen confirm their place in the Champions League play-offs with a 3-0 win against Villarreal in their final league-phase outing.

item.title: Pafos narrowly miss out on Champions League play-offs
item.description: Pafos comprehensively beat Slavia Prague 4-1 in their Champions League match at the Alphamega Stadium.

item.title: Late Hezze goal sends Olympiacos into the play-offs
item.description: A late goal from Santiago Hezze gave Olympiacos the win against Ajax and sees the Greek side progress into the knockout phase play-offs in the Champions League.

item.title: Atalanta in play-offs after defeat at Union SG
item.description: Atalanta progress to the Champions League play-offs with a 15th-placed finish despite a 1-0 defeat by Union Saint-Gilloise in their final league phase game.

item.title: Monaco and Juventus both through to play-offs
item.description: Monaco and Juventus will both feature in the Champions League knockout play-offs in February after playing out a goalless draw.

item.title: When is the Champions League play-off draw and how does it work?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains how the Champions League knockout phase play-offs work and when the draw is taking place.

item.title: What awaits interim boss Lindsay in Northern Ireland women's job?
item.description: BBC Sport NI looks at some of the issues Northern Ireland's incoming interim boss Kris Lindsay will look to address before World Cup 2027 qualifying begins in March.

item.title: Rare night of joy for Salah and Slot amid turbulent season
item.description: After sweeping their way into the last 16, chief football writer Phil McNulty asks can the Champions League rescue Liverpool's season of turmoil?

item.title: England on course for fifth Champions League spot
item.description: Could the Premier League get an extra place in the Champions League again? This is how it looks at the end of the league phase.

item.title: What do fans think of the Women's Champions Cup?
item.description: Arsenal played their first match of the inaugural Women’s Champions Cup on Wednesday - but how is the competition being received by supporters?

item.title: Sterling leaves Chelsea 18 months early - where could he go next?
item.description: Raheem Sterling leaves Chelsea by mutual consent after reaching an agreement on his departure.

item.title: Selling stars - how Man City have turned player sales into big business
item.description: Manchester City have made more than £250m selling young players from their talent factory over the last five years.

item.title: Will Bowie be next Scot to light up Serie A?
item.description: Hellas Verona are keen on Kieron Bowie - so will the Hibernian striker be the next Scot to shine in Serie A?

item.title: Quiz: Name every team to have played in Champions League knockouts
item.description: Since the European Cup became the Champions League in 1992-93, 77 teams have made it to the knockouts.

item.title: Coutinho advice & Adriano comparison - Bournemouth's new Brazilian teen
item.description: Bournemouth have made 19-year-old Brazilian forward Rayan their second most-expensive signing. Who is he and how good can he be?

item.title: What happens next after latest link between heading and brain disease?
item.description: BBC Sport explores the ramifications of the verdict that heading footballs is "likely" to have contributed to Gordon McQueen's death.

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Which countries haven't had a Premier League player?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore which countries have not been represented in the Premier League.

item.title: Which countries are set to win extra Champions League places?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains which countries are on course to win extra qualification spots for the 2026-27 Champions League campaign.

item.title: Can January signings play in the Champions League?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Antoine Semenyo and Conor Gallagher won't yet be able to play for their new clubs in the Champions League.

item.title: How much has Guardiola spent on defenders at Man City?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at how many defenders Manchester City have signed since Pep Guardiola arrived at the Etihad.

item.title: What is it like to be a caretaker manager?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what life is like as a caretaker boss after Michael Carrick's appointment at Manchester United, with Neil Warnock and Phil Brown detailing their experiences.

item.title: Who is Manchester City debutant Max Alleyne?
item.description: Manchester City defender Max Alleyne will make his Premier League debut on Wednesday after being named in Pep Guardiola's team to face Brighton.

item.title: What is the Women's Champions Cup and who do Arsenal play in final?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Fifa's new Women's Champions Cup.

item.title: 'Livewire' Mato joins Hearts on loan before summer deal
item.description: Hearts confirm a loan deal until the end of the season for Vardar forward Rogers Mato, who will join the club permanently in the summer.

item.title: Championship top scorer Fowler joins St Johnstone
item.description: St Johnstone confirm the signing of Queen's Park striker Josh Fowler, the Scottish Championship's top scorer this season.

item.title: Utrecht ideal final Europa League visitors for Celtic?
item.description: Utrecht have had a miserable time of it in the Europa League, and Celtic will be looking to inflict a seventh defeat in eight league phase games on the Dutch side on Thursday.

item.title: In-form Porto will test Rangers' improvement
item.description: Porto will present the biggest challenge of Rangers' recent improvement under head coach Danny Rohl.

item.title: Why La Liga title race is back on
item.description: A slip from Barcelona and a resurgent Real Madrid means the title race is back on in La Liga.

item.title: Who can join Aston Villa in Europa League last 16?
item.description: Aston Villa are through to the Europa League last 16 already - but with one round of matches to play in the league phase, only two of the other three British sides have a chance of joining them.

item.title: Forest sign 6ft 7in Napoli striker Lucca on loan
item.description: Nottingham Forest sign Napoli striker Lorenzo Lucca on loan until the end of the season with an option to buy in the summer.

item.title: US striker Dunn retires from professional football
item.description: US forward Crystal Dunn, 33, has called time on her professional career after more than a decade at the top of women's football.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
